timeline.body: "cannot find a symbol" is too specific for LinkageProblem. Some subclasses (ClassNotFoundProblem and SymoblNotFoundProblem) apply to "missing symbol" but other cases, such as AbstractMethodProblem, InaccessibleMemberProblem, and InaccessibleClassProblem, do not apply to "cannot find a symbol".
timeline.bodyText: "cannot find a symbol" is too specific for LinkageProblem. Some subclasses (ClassNotFoundProblem and SymoblNotFoundProblem) apply to "missing symbol" but other cases, such as AbstractMethodProblem, InaccessibleMemberProblem, and InaccessibleClassProblem, do not apply to "cannot find a symbol".
timeline.bodyHTML: "cannot find a symbol" is too specific for LinkageProblem. Some subclasses (ClassNotFoundProblem and SymoblNotFoundProblem) apply to "missing symbol" but other cases, such as AbstractMethodProblem, InaccessibleMemberProblem, and InaccessibleClassProblem, do not apply to "cannot find a symbol".
timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: Memo this word dependency comes from https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/LinkageError.html
replies.author: suztomo

timeline.message: contains a symbolic reference to a symbol that is not available

timeline.body:
```suggestion
 * A {@code methodSymbol} is not implemented in the {@code implementationClass} but the class
```
timeline.bodyText:
